intro: Geosiris, commonly known as the rock violet, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Boraginaceae. These plants are characterized by their hairy stems and showy, often violet-colored flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Geosiris species are typically found in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or arctic regions. They have small, lance-shaped leaves and produce capsule fruits that contain several seeds. The genus includes around 10 species, many of which are adapted to harsh, cold environments.
